formal_type: ∀ {K : Type u} {V V₁ : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] [inst_3 : AddCommGroup V₁] [inst_4 : Module K V₁] (f : V →ₗ[K] V₁), Module.rank K ↥(LinearMap.range f) + Module.rank K ↥(LinearMap.ker f) = Module.rank K V

∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {V₂ : Type v'} [inst_3 : AddCommGroup V₂] [inst_4 : Module K V₂] [inst_5 : FiniteDimensional K V] (f : V →ₗ[K] V₂), finrank K ↥(LinearMap.range f) + finrank K ↥(LinearMap.ker f) = finrank K V
docstring:
rank-nullity theorem : the dimensions of the kernel and the range of a linear map add up to
the dimension of the source space.

formal_type: ∀ {K : Type u} {V V₁ : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] [inst_3 : AddCommGroup V₁] [inst_4 : Module K V₁] (f : V →ₗ[K] V₁), Surjective ⇑f → Module.rank K V = Module.rank K V₁ + Module.rank K ↥(LinearMap.ker f)

∀ {K : Type u} {V V₁ V₂ V₃ : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] [inst_3 : AddCommGroup V₁] [inst_4 : Module K V₁] [inst_5 : AddCommGroup V₂] [inst_6 : Module K V₂] [inst_7 : AddCommGroup V₃] [inst_8 : Module K V₃] (db : V₂ →ₗ[K] V) (eb : V₃ →ₗ[K] V) (cd : V₁ →ₗ[K] V₂) (ce : V₁ →ₗ[K] V₃), ⊤ ≤ LinearMap.range db ⊔ LinearMap.range eb → LinearMap.ker cd = ⊥ → db ∘ₗ cd = eb ∘ₗ ce → (∀ (d : V₂) (e : V₃), db d = eb e → ∃ c, cd c = d ∧ ce c = e) → Module.rank K V + Module.rank K V₁ = Module.rank K V₂ + Module.rank K V₃
docstring: This is mostly an auxiliary lemma for `Submodule.rank_sup_add_rank_inf_eq`.

formal_type: ∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {V₂ : Type v'} [inst_3 : AddCommGroup V₂] [inst_4 : Module K V₂] [inst_5 : FiniteDimensional K V] [inst_6 : FiniteDimensional K V₂], finrank K V = finrank K V₂ → ∀ {f : V →ₗ[K] V₂}, LinearMap.ker f = ⊥ ↔ LinearMap.range f = ⊤

∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] {f : End K V} {m : ℕ}, finrank K V ≤ m → LinearMap.ker (f ^ m) = LinearMap.ker (f ^ finrank K V)
∀ (K : Type u) (V : Type v) [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V], ↑(finrank K V) = Module.rank K V
docstring:
In a finite-dimensional space, its dimension (seen as a cardinal) coincides with its
`finrank`. This is a copy of `finrank_eq_rank _ _` which creates easier typeclass searches.

formal_type: ∀ {𝕜 : Type u_2} [inst : IsROrC 𝕜] {V : Type u_1} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : InnerProductSpace 𝕜 V] [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 V] {S : Submodule 𝕜 V} (L : ↥S →ₗᵢ[𝕜] V), finrank 𝕜 ↥(LinearMap.range L.toLinearMap)ᗮ = finrank 𝕜 ↥Sᗮ
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] (v : V), v ≠ 0 → (finrank K V = 1 ↔ span K {v} = ⊤)
docstring: A vector space with a nonzero vector `v` has dimension 1 iff `v` spans.

formal_type: ∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] {f : V →ₗ[K] V}, LinearMap.ker f = ⊥ ↔ LinearMap.range f = ⊤
